alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Coconino Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 1:39AM MST until February 26 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...A strong cold front will continue to push across the area this morning, with moderate to heavy snow bands developing from west to east. Snow levels will fall dramatically behind this front, but the heaviest and most impactful snow amounts will mainly reside above 5000-6000 feet, along with blowing and drifting snow, with southwest wind gusts from 30 to 45. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Grand Canyon, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Payson, Pine-Strawberry, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Seligman, Shonto, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Additional snow forecast from 1 AM Today to 2 PM Today: Doney Park 3 to 5 inches Flagstaff 5 to 9 inches Forest Lakes 6 to 10 inches Grand Canyon 2 to 4 inches Heber-Overgaard 3 to 5 inches Jacob Lake 3 to 5 inches North Rim 3 to 5 inches Payson 2 to 4 inches Pine-Strawberry 4 to 8 inches Prescott 2 to 4 inches Prescott Valley 1 to 2 inches Seligman 1 to 2 inches Shonto 1 to 3 inches Valle 2 to 4 inches Williams 4 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
